text: Helena D. Cooper-Thomas (born 1970) is a New Zealand organisational behaviour academic. She is currently a full professor at the Auckland University of Technology. ==Academic career== After a Masters at the University of Saskatchewan, she completed a PhD at Goldsmith College, University of London and then worked in industry for Shell. She rejoined academia at the University of Auckland before moving to Auckland University of Technology. Her work on topics such as work hours, workplace bullying and burnout is covered regularly in the New Zealand media. ==Selected works== * Chen, Gilad, Robert E.
